document.docAuthor: Cheng, Zhi-Fei, Shavrin, Alexey V. & Peng, Zhong
document.masterDocTitle: New species and records of Geodromicus Redtenbacher, 1857 from China (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Omaliinae: Anthophagini)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 102–106. Male of
Geodromicus szechwanensis
(Shaanxi): 102–abdominal tergite VIII, 103–abdominal sternite VIII, 104–aedeagus, dorsal view, 105–aedeagus, lateral view, 106–aedeagus, parameral view. Scale bar: 0.2 mm.

FIGURES 107–111. Aedeagus (parameral view) of
Geodromicus szechwanensis
: 107–Henan, 108–109–Shaanxi, 110–Ningxia, 111–Sichuan. Scale bar: 0.2 mm.

FIGURE 112. Distribution of three species of
Geodromicus
in China:
G . lucidus
,
G . paramerus
(including type locality in Russia) and
G . szechwanensis
in China.

Geodromicus
in China: 1–

, 2–

Remarks. This species was described by Bernhauer (1943) from Sichuan . It was recorded from Shaanxi and Hubei by Shavrin (2018) . Habitus as in Fig. 96 . Male abdominal tergite VIII as in Fig. 102 , and male abdominal sternite VIII as in Fig. 103. A comparison of the shapes of the aedeagi of
G. szechwanensis
from different localities shows insignificant variability of the apical portion of the median lobe and the parameres ( Figs. 104–111 ). The distribution of the species in China is shown in Fig. 112 . The species is here recorded from Henan and Ningxia Autonomous Region for the first time.
